channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Stability analysis for set-valued optimization in Geoffroy spaces
item.description: arXiv:2503.03405v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this work, we study the external and internal stability of minimal solutions to set-valued optimization problems in a new functional framework. We consider perturbations on both the objective function and the admissible domain. To address these problems, we introduce two variational convergences for sequences of set-valued maps, namely the Gamma-cone convergence and the sequential Gamma-cone convergence. The upper and the lower convergence of strong level sets are also studied.
item.dc:creator: James Larrouy

item.title: Involutive quantales and quantale-enriched involutive topological spaces
item.description: arXiv:2503.03498v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: In this paper, we provide a comprehensive analysis of involutive quantales, with a particular focus on quantic frames. We extend the axiomatic foundations of quantale-enriched topological spaces to include closure under the anti-homomorphic involution, facilitating a balanced topologization of the spectrum of unital $C^*$-algebras that encompasses both closed right and left ideals through the concept of quantic frames. Specifically, certain subspaces of pure states are identified as strongly Hausdorff separated quantale-enriched involutive topological spaces.
item.dc:creator: Javier Guti\'errez Garc\'ia, Ulrich H\"ohle

item.title: On Baire property, compactness and completeness properties of spaces of Baire functions
item.description: arXiv:2211.10765v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: A topological space $X$ is Baire if the intersection of any sequence of open dense subsets of $X$ is dense in $X$. One of the interesting problems for the space of Baire functions is the Banakh-Gabriyelyan problem: Let $\alpha$ be a countable ordinal. Characterize topological spaces $X$ and $Y$ for which the function space $B_{\alpha}(X,Y)$ is Baire. In this paper, for any Frechet space $Y$ , we have obtained a characterization topological spaces $X$ for which the function space $B_{\alpha}(X,Y)$ is Baire. In particular, we proved that $B_{\alpha}(X,\mathbb{R})$ is Baire if and only if $B_{\alpha}(X,Y)$ is Baire for any Banach space $Y$. Also we proved that many completeness and compactness properties coincide in spaces $B_{\alpha}(X,Y)$ for any Frechet space $Y$.
item.dc:creator: Alexander V. Osipov

item.title: Tightness type properties of spaces of quasicontinuous functions
item.description: arXiv:2403.04004v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Using approximation by continuous functions we prove the following statements to types of tightness in a space $Q_p(X, \mathbb{R})$ of all quasicontinuous real-valued functions with the topology $\tau_p$ of pointwise convergence: the countability of tightness (fan-tightness, strong fan-tightness) at a point $f$ of space $Q_p(X, \mathbb{R})$ implies the countability of tightness (fan-tightness, strong fan-tightness) of space $Q_p(X,Y)$ of all quasicontinuous functions from $X$ into any non-one-point metrizable space $Y$. This result is the answer to the open question in the class of metrizable spaces.
item.dc:creator: Anton E. Lipin, Alexander V. Osipov

item.title: Semi-coarse Spaces: Fundamental Groupoid and the van Kampen Theorem
item.description: arXiv:2404.08874v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: In algebraic topology, the fundamental groupoid is a classical homotopy invariant which is defined using continuous maps from the closed interval to a topological space. In this paper, we construct a semi-coarse version of this invariant, using as paths a finite sequences of maps from $\mathbb{Z}_1$ to a semi-coarse space, connecting their tails through semi-coarse homotopy. In contrast to semi-coarse homotopy groups, this groupoid is not necessarily trivial for coarse spaces, and, unlike coarse homotopy, it is well-defined for general semi-coarse spaces. In addition, we show that the semi-coarse fundamental groupoid which we introduce admits a version of the Van Kampen Theorem.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Trevi\~no-Marroqu\'in
